reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 358/11: APPOINTMENT OF PERSONS WITH INVESTIGATIVE POWERS
reg_info.reg_name_text: APPOINTMENT OF PERSONS WITH INVESTIGATIVE POWERS

content.section: Classes of persons that may be appointed
content.content: 1. The Chief Coroner may only appoint the following classes of persons under section 16.1 of the Act: 1. A member of the College of Nurses of Ontario or a former member of the College who did not cease to be a member for a reason related to professional misconduct, incompetence or incapacity. 2. A paramedic, as defined in the Ambulance Act, or a former paramedic who did not stop working as a paramedic for a reason related to misconduct, incompetence or incapacity. 3. A police officer or a former police officer who did not cease to be a police officer for a reason related to misconduct, incompetence or incapacity. O. Reg. 358/11, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. The Chief Coroner may only appoint the following classes of persons under section 16.1 of the Act:

1. A member of the College of Nurses of Ontario or a former member of the College who did not cease to be a member for a reason related to professional misconduct, incompetence or incapacity.

2. A paramedic, as defined in the Ambulance Act, or a former paramedic who did not stop working as a paramedic for a reason related to misconduct, incompetence or incapacity.

3. A police officer or a former police officer who did not cease to be a police officer for a reason related to misconduct, incompetence or incapacity. O. Reg. 358/11, s. 1.

content.section: Classes of persons that may be appointed
content.content: 2. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 358/11, s. 2. Français
content.raw_html:
2. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 358/11, s. 2.
